title: How to Hook a Rug

steps.headline: Purchase a latch hooked rug kit.

steps.headline: Read the instructions for the rug.
steps.description: Learn which colors are represented by which symbols on the chart.

steps.headline: Sort out the cut yarn pieces by color.
Begin hooking the rug.Begin at the lower left hand corner, or start at the lower right hand corner if you are left handed, and take a string of the first color.

"}Take the ends of the loop and put them over the canvas bar, through the latch and under the actual hook.

steps.headline: Close the latch and pull firmly on the hook handle so that you're pulling the yarn ends back under the canvas bar and through the original loop.
steps.description: The yarn should be neatly attached to the canvas by a slip-type knot (sometimes known as a larkshead knot).

steps.headline: Continue across the row, paying close attention to the color chart.
Proceed row by row up the pattern until you're done.

tyn: A rug hooking kit containing a pattern, a canvas, cut yarn in the colors needed and a pattern/instruction sheet.
A rug hook (if the kit doesn't come with one).

Purchase a latch hooked rug kit. It should contain: {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/ba/A3_950.JPG/460px-A3_950.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/ba/A3_950.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570.6188925081433,"licensing":"

"}Take the ends of the loop and put them over the canvas bar, through the latch and under the actual hook. Close the latch and pull firmly on the hook handle so that you're pulling the yarn ends back under the canvas bar and through the original loop. The yarn should be neatly attached to the canvas by a slip-type knot (sometimes known as a larkshead knot). Continue across the row, paying close attention to the color chart. Proceed row by row up the pattern until you're done.

Read the instructions for the rug.
Learn which colors are represented by which symbols on the chart.
Sort out the cut yarn pieces by color.
Begin hooking the rug.Begin at the lower left hand corner, or start at the lower right hand corner if you are left handed, and take a string of the first color.

"}Take the ends of the loop and put them over the canvas bar, through the latch and under the actual hook.
Close the latch and pull firmly on the hook handle so that you're pulling the yarn ends back under the canvas bar and through the original loop.
The yarn should be neatly attached to the canvas by a slip-type knot (sometimes known as a larkshead knot).
Continue across the row, paying close attention to the color chart.
Proceed row by row up the pattern until you're done.
